blocks.content: Extend the definition of a class to include the set size function.

blocks.content: Define the set size function ` # ` , which gives the cardinality of a finite set as a member of ` NN0 ` , and assigns all infinite sets the value ` +oo ` . For example, ` ( # `` { 0 , 1 , 2 } ) = 3 ` ( ~ ex-hash ). (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: hashkf
blocks.content: The finite part of the size function maps all finite sets to their cardinality, as members of ` NN0 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashkf(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wf(c0, cfn, cn0)
  -| wceq(c1, cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  -| wceq(c0, ccom(c1, ccrd))
} = {
  mpbir2an(wf(c0, cfn, cn0), wfn(c0, cfn), wral(hs0, cfn, wcel(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cn0)))
  mpbir(wfn(c0, cfn), wfn(ccom(c1, ccrd), cfn))
  mpbir2an(wfn(ccom(c1, ccrd), cfn), wfun(ccom(c1, ccrd)), wceq(cdm(ccom(c1, ccrd)), cfn))
  mp2an(wfun(ccom(c1, ccrd)), wfun(c1), wfun(ccrd))
  ax-mp(wfun(c1), wfn(c1, com))
  fnfun(c1, com)
  funco(c1, ccrd)
  3eqtri(cdm(ccom(c1, ccrd)), cfn, cima(ccnv(ccrd), cdm(c1)), cima(ccnv(ccrd), com))
  dmco(c1, ccrd)
  imaeq2i(ccnv(ccrd), cdm(c1), com)
  ax-mp(wceq(cdm(c1), com), wfn(c1, com))
  mpbir(wfn(c1, com), wfn(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), com))
  frfnom(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0)
  fneq1i(c1, com, cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  fndm(c1, com)
  eqriv(hs0, cima(ccnv(ccrd), com), cfn)
  bitri(wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(ccrd), com)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com)))
  ax-mp(wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cima(ccnv(ccrd), com)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com))), wfn(ccrd, cdm(ccrd)))
  mpbi(wfn(ccrd, cdm(ccrd)), wfun(ccrd))
  funfn(ccrd)
  elpreima(ccrd, cdm(ccrd), cv(hs0), com)
  impbii(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wrex(s0, com, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(s0))))
  syl2anr(wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com), wrex(s0, com, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(s0))), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0))))
  id(wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com))
  ensymd(cv(hs0), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)))
  cardid2(cv(hs0))
  rspcev(s0, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(s0)))
  breq2(cv(s0), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), cen)
  isfi(s0, cv(hs0))
  jca(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com))
  df-fn(ccom(c1, ccrd), cfn)
  fneq1i(c0, cfn, ccom(c1, ccrd))
  rgen(hs0, cfn, wcel(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cn0))
  eqeltrd(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cn0, cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  syl5eq(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0))), cfv(ccom(c1, ccrd), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  fveq1i(c0, cv(hs0), ccom(c1, ccrd))
  sylancr(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wceq(cfv(ccom(c1, ccrd), cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)))), wfun(ccrd), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)))
  ax-mp(wfun(ccrd), wf(ccrd, cab(hs0, wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)))), con0))
  cardf2(hs0, s0)
  ffun(ccrd, cab(hs0, wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)))), con0)
  finnum(cv(hs0))
  fvco(ccrd, cv(hs0), c1)
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0))), cn0), wcel(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com))
  ficardom(cv(hs0))
  ffvelrni(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), com, c1, cn0)
  ax-mp(wf(c1, com, cn0), wf1o(c1, com, cn0))
  hashgf1o(s0, c1)
  f1of(c1, com, cn0)
  ffnfv(hs0, c0, cfn, cn0)
  diff.hs0.c(cima(ccnv(ccrd), com))
  diff.hs0.c(cfn)
  diff.com.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, cv(hs0), cen, cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)))
  diff.cen.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ccrd, cv(hs0))
  diff.ccrd.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cn0)
}

blocks.content: The value of the ` # ` function in terms of the mapping ` G ` from ` _om ` to ` NN0 ` . The proof avoids the use of ~ ax-ac . (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2014.)

thm hashgval(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, c0)), cfv(chash, c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, c0)), cfv(chash, c0))), diffsc(s0, c0))
  eqtr3d(cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, c0)), cfv(chash, c0), cfv(cres(chash, cfn), c0), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl5eq(cfv(cres(chash, cfn), c0), cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, c0)), cfv(ccom(c1, ccrd), c0), wcel(c0, cfn))
  fveq1i(cres(chash, cfn), c0, ccom(c1, ccrd))
  3eqtr4i(cres(chash, cfn), ccom(c1, ccrd), cres(cun(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf))), cfn), ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd))
  eqtri(cres(cun(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf))), cfn), ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cun(cres(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn), cres(cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf)), cfn)))
  resundir(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf)), cfn)
  eqtri(cun(cres(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn), cres(cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf)), cfn)), ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cun(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), emptycls))
  uneq12i(cres(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn), cres(cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf)), cfn), ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), emptycls)
  mp2b(wceq(cres(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn), ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd)), wf(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn, cn0), wfn(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn))
  hashkf(s0, ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  eqid(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  eqid(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd))
  ffn(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn, cn0)
  fnresdm(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cfn)
  mpbi(wceq(cres(cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf)), cfn), emptycls), wceq(cin(cdif(universe, cfn), cfn), emptycls))
  eqtri(cin(cdif(universe, cfn), cfn), emptycls, cin(cfn, cdif(universe, cfn)))

  fconst(cdif(universe, cfn), cpnf)
  pnfex()
  ffn(cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf)), cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf))
  fnresdisj(cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf)), cdif(universe, cfn), cfn)
  un0(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd))
  reseq1i(chash, cfn, cun(ccom(cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), ccrd), cxp(cdif(universe, cfn), csn(cpnf))))
  df-hash(s0)
  coeq1i(c1, ccrd, cres(crdg(cmpt(s0, universe, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(ccom(c1, ccrd), c0), cfv(c1, cfv(ccrd, c0))), wfun(ccrd), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
  ax-mp(wfun(ccrd), wf(ccrd, cab(s0, wrex(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(s0)))), con0))
  cardf2(s0, hs0)
  ffun(ccrd, cab(s0, wrex(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cv(s0)))), con0)
  finnum(c0)
  fvco(ccrd, c0, c1)
  fvres(c0, cfn, chash)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: hasheni
blocks.content: Equinumerous sets have the same number of elements (even if they are not finite). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm hasheni(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, c1)))
} = {
  pm2.61dan(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, c1)), wcel(c1, cfn))
  mpbird(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  simpl(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn))
  sylancom(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn), wb(wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  ancoms(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))
  enfii(c1, c0)
  hashen(c0, c1)
  eqtr4d(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, c1), cpnf, wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wn(wcel(c1, cfn))))
  syl2an2r(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wn(wcel(c1, cfn)), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cpnf), wcel(c0, universe), wn(wcel(c0, cfn)))
  brrelex1i(c0, cen, c1)
  biimpar(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wn(wcel(c1, cfn)), wn(wcel(c0, cfn)))
  notbid(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn))
  enfi(c0, c1)
  hashinf(c0, universe)
  sylan(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wn(wcel(c1, cfn)), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), cpnf), wcel(c1, universe))
  brrelex2i(c0, cen, c1)
  relen()
  hashinf(c1, universe)
}

blocks.name: hasheqf1o
blocks.content: The size of two finite sets is equal if and only if there is a bijection mapping one of the sets onto the other. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Dec-2017.)

blocks.name: fiinfnf1o
blocks.content: There is no bijection between a finite set and an infinite set. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Dec-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm fiinfnf1o(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  con3dimp(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn), wex(s0, wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c1)))

blocks.name: focdmex
blocks.content: The codomain of an onto function is a set if its domain is a set. (Contributed by AV, 4-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: hasheqf1od
blocks.content: The size of two sets is equal if there is a bijection mapping one of the sets onto the other. (Contributed by AV, 4-May-2021.)

thm hasheqf1od(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {

} = {
  sylc(w0, wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, c1)), wcel(c0, c2), wex(hs0, wf1o(cv(hs0), c0, c1)))
  elabd(hs0, c3, w0, wf1o(cv(hs0), c0, c1), wf1o(c3, c0, c1))
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(c3, universe), wf(c3, c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2))
  syl(w0, wf(c3, c0, c1), wf1o(c3, c0, c1))
  f1of(c3, c0, c1)
  fex(c3, c0, c1, c2)
  f1oeq1(cv(hs0), c3, c0, c1)

  diff.hs0.w(wf1o(c3, c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: fz1eqb
blocks.content: Two possibly-empty 1-based finite sets of sequential integers are equal iff their endpoints are equal. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 29-Mar-2014.)

  eqeltrrd(cfv(chash, c0), cn0, cfv(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), cfv(ccrd, c0)), wcel(c0, cfn))

  syl(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cfv(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), cfv(ccrd, c0)), cn0), wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), com))

  ffvelrni(cfv(ccrd, c0), com, cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), cn0)
  ax-mp(wf(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), com, cn0), wf1o(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), com, cn0))
  hashgf1o(hs0, cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  eqid(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com))
  f1of(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat0), com), com, cn0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: nfile
blocks.content: The size of any infinite set is always greater than or equal to the size of any set. (Contributed by AV, 13-Nov-2020.)

blocks.name: hashvnfin
blocks.content: A set of finite size is a finite set. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 8-Dec-2017.)

blocks.name: hashnfinnn0
blocks.content: The size of an infinite set is not a nonnegative integer. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Dec-2017.) (Proof shortened by Alexander van der Vekens, 18-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: isfinite4
blocks.content: A finite set is equinumerous to the range of integers from one up to the hash value of the set. In other words, counting objects with natural numbers works if and only if it is a finite collection. (Contributed by Richard Penner, 26-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm isfinite4(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0))
} = {
  impbii(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0))
  mpbid(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0), wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), cfv(chash, c0)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), cfv(chash, c0)), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0))
  hashcl(c0)
  hashfz1(cfv(chash, c0))
  mpan(wcel(c0, cfn), wb(wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), cfv(chash, c0)), wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0)), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfn))
  hashen(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c0)
  mpsyl(wbr(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cen, c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfn), wbr(c0, cen, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))))
  fzfi(nat1, cfv(chash, c0))
  ensym(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), c0)
  biimprcd(wcel(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)), cfn), wbr(c0, cen, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(c0, cfn))
  enfi(c0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c0)))
}

thm hasheq0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wceq(cfv(chash, c0), nat0), wceq(c0, emptycls)))
} = {

  nsyl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn))), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), nat0), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cr))
  mtbiri(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn))), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cr), wcel(cpnf, cr))
  neli(cpnf, cr)
  pnfnre()
  eleq1d(cfv(chash, c0), cr, cpnf, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn))))
  hashinf(c0, c1)
  syl6eqel(cfv(chash, c0), cr, nat0, wceq(cfv(chash, c0), nat0))
  id(wceq(cfv(chash, c0), nat0))
  0re()
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wn(wceq(c0, emptycls)))
  con3i(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  syl6eqel(c0, cfn, emptycls, wceq(c0, emptycls))
  id(wceq(c0, emptycls))
  3bitr3g(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), nat0), wceq(c0, emptycls), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, emptycls)), wbr(c0, cen, emptycls))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, cfn), wb(wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cfv(chash, emptycls)), wbr(c0, cen, emptycls)), wcel(emptycls, cfn))
  0fin()
  hashen(c0, emptycls)

  fz10()
  ax-mp(wceq(cfv(chash, co(nat1, cfz, nat0)), nat0), wcel(nat0, cn0))
  0nn0()
  hashfz1(nat0)
  en0(c0)
}

blocks.name: hashdomi
blocks.content: Non-strict order relation of the ` # ` function on the full cardinal poset. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashdomi(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, cfv(chash, c1)))
} = {
  pm2.61dan(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, cfv(chash, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  mpbird(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wcel(c0, cfn)), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, cfv(chash, c1)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
  simpl(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl2anc(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wcel(c0, cfn)), wb(wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, cfv(chash, c1)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, universe))
  simpr(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wcel(c0, cfn))
  adantr(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, universe))
  hashdom(c0, c1, universe)
  3brtr4d(cfv(chash, c0), cle, cfv(chash, c1), cpnf, cpnf, wa(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn))))
  mp1i(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn))), wbr(cpnf, cle, cpnf), wcel(cpnf, cxr))
  pnfxr()
  pnfge(cpnf)
  sylan(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wceq(cfv(chash, c0), cpnf), wcel(c0, universe))
  brrelex1i(c0, cdom, c1)
  hashinf(c0, universe)
  syl2anc(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn))), wceq(cfv(chash, c1), cpnf), wcel(c1, universe), wn(wcel(c1, cfn)))
  adantr(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(c1, universe))
  brrelex2i(c0, cdom, c1)
  reldom()
  stoic1b(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn))
  domfi(c1, c0)
  hashinf(c1, universe)
}

blocks.name: 1elfz0hash

blocks.name: hashunsng
blocks.content: The size of the union of a finite set with a disjoint singleton is one more than the size of the set. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 30-Nov-2012.)

blocks.name: prhash2ex
blocks.content: There is (at least) one set with two different elements: the unordered pair containing ` 0 ` and ` 1 ` . In contrast to ~ pr0hash2ex , numbers are used instead of sets because their representation is shorter (and more comprehensive). (Contributed by AV, 29-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: hashle00
blocks.content: If the size of a set is less than or equal to zero, the set must be empty. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jan-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)

blocks.name: hashin
blocks.content: The size of the intersection of a set and a class is less than or equal to the size of the set. (Contributed by AV, 4-Jan-2021.)

blocks.name: hashdif
blocks.content: The size of the difference of a finite set and another set is the first set's size minus that of the intersection of both. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 24-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: hashdifsn
blocks.content: The size of the difference of a finite set and a singleton subset is the set's size minus 1. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 6-Jan-2018.)

blocks.name: hashsn01
blocks.content: The size of a singleton is either 0 or 1. (Contributed by AV, 23-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: hashsnle1
blocks.content: The size of a singleton is less than or equal to 1. (Contributed by AV, 23-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: hashsnlei
blocks.content: Get an upper bound on a concretely specified finite set. Base case: singleton set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: hash1snb

blocks.name: hashunlei
blocks.content: Get an upper bound on a concretely specified finite set. Induction step: union of two finite bounded sets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashunlei(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, c1))
  -| wceq(c0, cun(c2, c3))
  -| wa(wcel(c2, cfn), wbr(cfv(chash, c2), cle, c4))
  -| wa(wcel(c3, cfn), wbr(cfv(chash, c3), cle, c5))
  -| wcel(c4, cn0)
  -| wcel(c5, cn0)
  -| wceq(co(c4, caddc, c5), c1)
} = {
  pm3.2i(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, c1))
  mp2an(wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, c1), wbr(cfv(chash, c0), cle, co(cfv(chash, c2), caddc, cfv(chash, c3))), wbr(co(cfv(chash, c2), caddc, cfv(chash, c3)), cle, c1))
  eqbrtri(cfv(chash, c0), cle, co(cfv(chash, c2), caddc, cfv(chash, c3)), cfv(chash, cun(c2, c3)))
  fveq2i(chash, c0, cun(c2, c3))
  mp2an(wbr(cfv(chash, cun(c2, c3)), cle, co(cfv(chash, c2), caddc, cfv(chash, c3))), wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(c3, cfn))
  hashun2(c2, c3)
  breqtri(co(cfv(chash, c2), caddc, cfv(chash, c3)), cle, c1, co(c4, caddc, c5))
  mp2an(wbr(co(cfv(chash, c2), caddc, cfv(chash, c3)), cle, co(c4, caddc, c5)), wbr(cfv(chash, c2), cle, c4), wbr(cfv(chash, c3), cle, c5))
  simpri(wbr(cfv(chash, c2), cle, c4), wcel(c2, cfn))
  simpri(wbr(cfv(chash, c3), cle, c5), wcel(c3, cfn))
  le2addi(cfv(chash, c2), c4, cfv(chash, c3), c5)
  letri(cfv(chash, c0), co(cfv(chash, c2), caddc, cfv(chash, c3)), c1)
  nn0rei(cfv(chash, c0))
  ax-mp(wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0), wcel(c0, cfn))
  eqeltri(c0, cfn, cun(c2, c3))
  mp2an(wcel(cun(c2, c3), cfn), wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(c3, cfn))
  unfi(c2, c3)
  hashcl(c0)

blocks.name: hashxp
blocks.content: The size of the Cartesian product of two finite sets is the product of their sizes. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 30-Nov-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashxp(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn)), wceq(cfv(chash, cxp(c0, c1)), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, c1))))
} = {
  impcom(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, cxp(c0, c1)), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, c1))))
  dedth(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn), wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, cxp(c0, c1)), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, c1)))), wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, cxp(c0, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)))), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)))))))
  imbi2d(wceq(c1, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn))), wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, cxp(c0, c1)), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, c1))), wceq(cfv(chash, cxp(c0, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)))), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn))))))
  eqeq12d(cfv(chash, cxp(c0, c1)), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, c1)), cfv(chash, cxp(c0, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)))), co(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)))), wceq(c1, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn))))
  fveq2d(chash, cxp(c0, c1), cxp(c0, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn))), wceq(c1, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn))))
  xpeq2(c1, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)), c0)
  oveq2d(cfv(chash, c0), cmul, cfv(chash, c1), cfv(chash, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn))), wceq(c1, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn))))
  fveq2(c1, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)), chash)
  hashxplem(c0, cif(c1, emptycls, wcel(c1, cfn)))
  elimel(c1, cfn, emptycls)
  0fin()
}

blocks.name: hashmap
blocks.content: The size of the set exponential of two finite sets is the exponential of their sizes. (This is the original motivation behind the notation for set exponentiation.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Aug-2014.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Jul-2022.)

blocks.name: hashpw
blocks.content: The size of the power set of a finite set is 2 raised to the power of the size of the set. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 30-Nov-2012.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 5-Aug-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashpw(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, cpw(c0)), co(nat2, cexp, cfv(chash, c0))))
} = {
  vtoclga(hs0, c0, cfn, wceq(cfv(chash, cpw(c0)), co(nat2, cexp, cfv(chash, c0))), wceq(cfv(chash, cpw(cv(hs0))), co(nat2, cexp, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)))))

  fveq2d(chash, cpw(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  pweq(cv(hs0), c0)
  oveq2d(nat2, cexp, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), cfv(chash, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, chash)
  eqtrd(cfv(chash, cpw(cv(hs0))), co(nat2, cexp, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), cfv(chash, co(c2o, cmap, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  mpbiri(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, cpw(cv(hs0))), cfv(chash, co(c2o, cmap, cv(hs0)))), wbr(cpw(cv(hs0)), cen, co(c2o, cmap, cv(hs0))))
  pw2en(cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  syl2anc(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wb(wceq(cfv(chash, cpw(cv(hs0))), cfv(chash, co(c2o, cmap, cv(hs0)))), wbr(cpw(cv(hs0)), cen, co(c2o, cmap, cv(hs0)))), wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), cfn), wcel(co(c2o, cmap, cv(hs0)), cfn))
  biimpi(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), cfn))
  pwfi(cv(hs0))
  mpan(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(co(c2o, cmap, cv(hs0)), cfn), wcel(c2o, cfn))
  mapfi(c2o, cv(hs0))

  eqeltri(c2o, cfn, cpr(emptycls, csn(emptycls)))
  df2o2()
  prfi(emptycls, csn(emptycls))
  hashmap(c2o, cv(hs0))
  oveq1i(cfv(chash, c2o), cexp, cfv(chash, cv(hs0)), nat2)
  hash2()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfn)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cfv(chash, cpw(c0)), co(nat2, cexp, cfv(chash, c0))))

blocks.name: hashres
blocks.content: The number of elements of a finite function restricted to a subset of its domain is equal to the number of elements of that subset. (Contributed by AV, 15-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashres(class c0, class c1) {

  mpbid(w3a(wfun(c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c1, cdm(c0))), wceq(cfv(chash, cres(c0, c1)), cfv(chash, cdm(cres(c0, c1)))), wfun(cres(c0, c1)))
  3ad2ant1(wfun(c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c1, cdm(c0)), wfun(cres(c0, c1)))
  funres(c0, c1)
  syl(w3a(wfun(c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c1, cdm(c0))), wb(wfun(cres(c0, c1)), wceq(cfv(chash, cres(c0, c1)), cfv(chash, cdm(cres(c0, c1))))), wcel(cres(c0, c1), cfn))
  3ad2ant2(wfun(c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c1, cdm(c0)), wcel(cres(c0, c1), cfn))
  finresfin(c0, c1)
  hashfun(cres(c0, c1))
  fveq2d(chash, cdm(cres(c0, c1)), c1, w3a(wfun(c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c1, cdm(c0))))
  3ad2ant3(wfun(c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c1, cdm(c0)), wceq(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), c1))
  biimpi(wss(c1, cdm(c0)), wceq(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), c1))

}

blocks.name: hashimarni
blocks.content: If the size of the image of a one-to-one function ` E ` under the range of a function ` F ` which is a one-to-one function into the domain of ` E ` is a nonnegative integer, the size of the function ` F ` is the same nonnegative integer. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 4-Feb-2018.)

blocks.name: fnfz0hash
blocks.content: The size of a function on a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Jun-2018.)

blocks.name: ffz0hash
blocks.content: The size of a function on a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers equals the upper bound of the sequence increased by 1. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 15-Mar-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 11-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: fnfz0hashnn0
blocks.content: The size of a function on a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers is a nonnegative integer. (Contributed by AV, 10-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: ffzo0hash
blocks.content: The size of a function on a half-open range of nonnegative integers. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-Mar-2018.)

blocks.name: fnfzo0hash
blocks.content: The size of a function on a half-open range of nonnegative integers equals the upper bound of this range. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-Jan-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 11-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: fnfzo0hashnn0
blocks.content: The value of the size function on a half-open range of nonnegative integers is a nonnegative integer. (Contributed by AV, 10-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: hashbc
blocks.content: The binomial coefficient counts the number of subsets of a finite set of a given size. This is Metamath 100 proof #58 (formula for the number of combinations). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jul-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashbc(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(co(cfv(chash, c0), cbc, c1), cfv(chash, crab(s0, cpw(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)

blocks.name: hashfacen
blocks.content: The number of bijections between two sets is a cardinal invariant. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: hashf1
blocks.content: The permutation number ` | A | ! x. ( | B | _C | A | ) = ` ` | B | ! / ( | B | - | A | ) ! ` counts the number of injections from ` A ` to ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: hashfac
blocks.content: A factorial counts the number of bijections on a finite set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Jan-2015.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Apr-2015.)

thm hashfac(setvar s0, class c0) {

  3eqtr3d(cfv(chash, cab(s0, wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c0))), cfv(cfa, cfv(chash, c0)), cfv(chash, cab(s0, wf1(cv(s0), c0, c0))), co(cfv(cfa, cfv(chash, c0)), cmul, co(cfv(chash, c0), cbc, cfv(chash, c0))), wcel(c0, cfn))
  anidms(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(cfv(chash, cab(s0, wf1(cv(s0), c0, c0))), co(cfv(cfa, cfv(chash, c0)), cmul, co(cfv(chash, c0), cbc, cfv(chash, c0)))))
  hashf1(s0, c0, c0)
  fveq2d(chash, cab(s0, wf1(cv(s0), c0, c0)), cab(s0, wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c0)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  abbidv(s0, wcel(c0, cfn), wf1(cv(s0), c0, c0), wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c0))
  mpancom(wcel(c0, cfn), wb(wf1(cv(s0), c0, c0), wf1o(cv(s0), c0, c0)), wbr(c0, cen, c0))
  enrefg(c0, cfn)
  f1finf1o(c0, c0, cv(s0))
  eqtrd(co(cfv(cfa, cfv(chash, c0)), cmul, co(cfv(chash, c0), cbc, cfv(chash, c0))), cfv(cfa, cfv(chash, c0)), co(cfv(cfa, cfv(chash, c0)), cmul, nat1), wcel(c0, cfn))
  oveq2d(cfv(cfa, cfv(chash, c0)), cmul, co(cfv(chash, c0), cbc, cfv(chash, c0)), nat1, wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(co(cfv(chash, c0), cbc, cfv(chash, c0)), nat1), wcel(cfv(chash, c0), cn0))
  bcnn(cfv(chash, c0))

blocks.name: fz1iso
blocks.content: Any finite ordered set has an order isomorphism to a one-based finite sequence. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm fz1iso(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wor(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wex(s0, wiso(cv(s0), clt, c0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(chash, c1)), c1)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  fz1isolem(s0, hs0, c0, c1, cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat1), com), cin(cn, cima(ccnv(clt), csn(co(cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1)))), cin(com, cfv(ccnv(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat1), com)), co(cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1))), coi(c0, c1))
  eqid(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat1), com))
  eqid(cin(cn, cima(ccnv(clt), csn(co(cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1)))))
  eqid(cin(com, cfv(ccnv(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat1), com)), co(cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1))))
  eqid(coi(c0, c1))
  diff.cres.s(s0, crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat1), com)
  diff.crdg.s(s0, cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)), nat1)
  diff.cmpt.s(s0, hs0, universe, co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat1))
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, cv(hs0), caddc, nat1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.com.s(s0)
  diff.cin.s(s0, cn, cima(ccnv(clt), csn(co(cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1))))
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.cima.s(s0, ccnv(clt), csn(co(cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1)))
  diff.ccnv.s(s0, clt)
  diff.clt.s(s0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, co(cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1))
  diff.co.s(s0, cfv(chash, c1), caddc, nat1)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, chash, c1)
  diff.chash.s(s0)
  diff.caddc.s(s0)
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.coi.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: ishashinf
blocks.content: Any set that is not finite contains subsets of arbitrarily large finite cardinality. Cf. ~ isinf . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 5-Jul-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm ishashinf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wral(s0, cn, wrex(s1, cpw(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s1)), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  ralrimiva(s0, cn, wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wrex(s1, cpw(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s1)), cv(s0))))
  sylibr(wa(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(cv(s0), cn)), wrex(s1, cpw(c0), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s1)), cv(s0))), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s1)), cv(s0)))))
  mpd(wa(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(cv(s0), cn)), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cpw(c0)), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s1)), cv(s0)))), wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)))))))
  syl2anr(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(cv(s0), cn), wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)))))), wcel(cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), com), wral(hs0, com, wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(hs0))))))
  syl(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wcel(cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), com), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)), cfn))
  ficardom(co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)))
  isinf(hs0, s1, c0)
  rspcva(hs0, cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))), com, wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(hs0)))), wex(s1, wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)))))))
  exbidv(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0)))), wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cv(hs0))), wa(wss(cv(s1), c0), wbr(cv(s1), cen, cfv(ccrd, co(nat1, cfz, cv(s0))))))

blocks.name: seqcoll
blocks.content: The function ` F ` contains a sparse set of nonzero values to be summed. The function ` G ` is an order isomorphism from the set of nonzero values of ` F ` to a 1-based finite sequence, and ` H ` collects these nonzero values together. Under these conditions, the sum over the values in ` H ` yields the same result as the sum over the original set ` F ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Apr-2014.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: seqcoll2
blocks.content: The function ` F ` contains a sparse set of nonzero values to be summed. The function ` G ` is an order isomorphism from the set of nonzero values of ` F ` to a 1-based finite sequence, and ` H ` collects these nonzero values together. Under these conditions, the sum over the values in ` H ` yields the same result as the sum over the original set ` F ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm seqcoll2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
